meanings.definition: Not engaging in play or recreation.
meanings.sent1: The children were in a nonplay mood today, preferring to read quietly instead.
meanings.sent2: She felt nonplay activities were just as important as playtime for her mental health.
meanings.sent3: The nonplay atmosphere in the room made everyone feel calm and relaxed.
meanings.sent4: His nonplay attitude towards sports surprised his friends, who knew him as an active person.
meanings.sent5: The nonplay environment of the library was perfect for studying in peace.

meanings.definition: A situation or period of time in which play is not occurring.
meanings.sent1: The playground was unusually quiet, a nonplay zone on a rainy day.
meanings.sent2: During the nonplay hours, the children focused on their schoolwork.
meanings.sent3: The nonplay during the power outage led to creative storytelling by candlelight.
meanings.sent4: The nonplay of the actors on stage left the audience puzzled and intrigued.
meanings.sent5: The nonplay of the sports field made it a peaceful spot for a picnic.
